urls.title: The River Lea is plagued by pollution ‚Äì it is no place for a swim | Letters
urls.description: Letters: Readers respond to a photo essay on bathers in the River Lea at Hackney Marshes in east London

text:
"We do know that local volunteers are pulling sanitary waste out of the river just upstream of 'Hackney Beach'." The reality of England's rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/rdKF8KpJFu

@timhobbs @WasteCrimeWatch @EnvAgency That is dealt with separately through POCA. The court will calculate the benefit (tax evaded) and then the realisable amount. If the realisable amount is not paid within 6 months, there will be a further term of imprisonment in default

@theboatrace @Gemini @row360 @CUBCsquad @OUWBCsquad @OxfordUniBC @ChapelDownWines @WainwrightBeer @PlayerLayer @Sarah_Winckless @metpoliceuk @EnvAgency @GBrowing @guinbatten @jamescracknell @matthewcpinsent @sebcoe Rob is an improving coach, but he cannot be Chief Coach for life. text: @WasteCrimeWatch @EnvAgency POCA usually take place after sentence. Report says date set for hearing. There is a statutory process to be followed. It takes time but process is draconian. It looks back 6 yrs prior to proceedings and assume any acquisition is the proceeds of crime unless proved otherwise

urls.title: Find a free fishing event | Canal & River Trust
urls.description: Want to learn to fish? Each year we run a season of free events called Let's Fish! Whether you have fished before or have always wanted to try, come along and give it a try on our canals.

text:
Our #LetsFish events begin on Monday 12 April. To find your next local #event and book a free #fishing session, visit our website - https://t.co/2XdLD8mQNS.
Thanks to players of @PostcodeLottery @EnvAgency @AnglingTrust and @nenescape for helping to make these events possible.
